title: Major League Cricket moves HQ to Grand Prairie
body:
Major League Cricket has announced the relocation of its headquarters to Grand Prairie, with the Texas city to also host the league’s playoffs and championship final during the upcoming 2025 season.

The league is currently based in San Francisco but is moving to Grand Prairie, a Dallas suburb, for the new season. Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium will host 12 regular-season games from June 20-29, along with the finals from July 8-13.

As previously announced, the season will begin at Oakland Coliseum, which will host nine games from June 12-18. The competition will then head to Grand Prairie for 12 regular-season games from June 20-29, before Broward County Stadium in Florida hosts regular-season games from July 1-6. The season will then conclude in Grand Prairie.

With 34 matches from coast to coast across three venues, this season of MLC will mark the largest top-tier professional cricket tournament ever held in the US.

Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium staged four matches during last year’s T20 World Cup in the US, including the host nation’s Super Over victory against Pakistan. The stadium will also host a women’s national team match between the US and Zimbabwe on Friday.

Johnny Grave, chief executive of MLC, said: “In addition to hosting 12 regular-season games, we are excited to bring the playoffs back to Grand Prairie and look forward to another sold-out championship final on July 13. We will continue to enhance the stadium to host top-tier international events – starting with this weekend’s exciting match-up between the US women’s team and Zimbabwe’s women’s team.”

MLC announced last month that the Oakland Coliseum, home of Major League Baseball’s Athletics, will host nine matches during the 2025 MLC season. The games will mark the league’s first visit to the west coast of the US.

The stadium will be adapted to accommodate professional cricket matches, with specialised drop-in turf wickets to be installed to meet international standards.

Last year marked the Coliseum’s final season as the home of the A’s, with the team set to spend three seasons in Sacramento before moving to Las Vegas in 2028. The stadium also started hosting USL Championship soccer club Oakland Roots at the start of the 2025 season.
summary:
**Key Points:**

* MLC is relocating its headquarters to Grand Prairie, Texas.
* Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium will host 12 regular-season games (June 20-29) and the playoffs/championship final (July 8-13) during the 2025 season.
* The 2025 season will feature 34 matches across three venues: Oakland Coliseum (June 12-18), Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium (June 20-29), and Broward County Stadium in Florida (July 1-6).
* The championship final will take place on July 13 at Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium.
* Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium has previously hosted international cricket matches, including four matches during last year's T20 World Cup.
* The stadium will undergo enhancements to host top-tier international events.

title: Australian cricketer Xavier Bartlett signs with San Francisco Unicorns for Major League Cricket 2025
body:
Australian fast bowler Xavier Bartlett has signed with the San Francisco Unicorns for the upcoming season of Major League Cricket (MLC) in the United States. Bartlett, who is currently playing in the Indian Premier League (IPL) for Punjab Kings under coach Ricky Ponting, will join fellow Australians Cooper Connolly, Jake Fraser-McGurk, and Matt Short at the Unicorns, according to ESPNcricinfo.

He made an impressive start to his T20 international career, picking up 11 wickets in seven matches with an economy rate of 6.84. During the 2023-24 season, Bartlett became the leading wicket-taker in the Big Bash League (BBL) for Brisbane Heat, which helped him earn his international debut.

Following his successful season, he was awarded a Cricket Australia contract, which he retained in the latest list released earlier this month. The 2025 edition of Major League Cricket will be held from June 12 to July 13. San Francisco Unicorns head coach Shane Watson praised Bartlett's bowling and his ability to lead the attack.

"Xavier has shown his prowess leading the bowling attack for the Brisbane Heat in the Big Bash League, and he will be a great addition to the Unicorns bowling line-up with his wicket-taking ability with the new ball," Watson said, as quoted by ESPNcricinfo.

Watson also noted Bartlett's growth through the Australian cricket system and his mature bowling approach.

"Having developed through the national pathways in Australia and onto the international scene, he's matured into a very clever pace bowler, able to both keep the rate down and break key partnerships," he added.
summary:
* Australian fast bowler Xavier Bartlett has signed with the San Francisco Unicorns for the upcoming season of Major League Cricket (MLC) in the United States.
* Bartlett will join fellow Australians Cooper Connolly, Jake Fraser-McGurk, and Matt Short at the Unicorns.
* The 2025 edition of Major League Cricket will be held from June 12 to July 13.
* San Francisco Unicorns head coach Shane Watson praised Bartlett's bowling and leadership abilities, citing his wicket-taking ability with the new ball and mature bowling approach.

title: SAN FRANCISCO UNICORNS RECRUIT FAST BOWLER XAVIER BARTLETT
body:
Australian international pace bowler to join up with San Francisco Unicorns for the 2025 Cognizant Major League Cricket season.

Bartlett will make his MLC debut following breakthrough seasons, which have seen him earn his first international caps and top the Big Bash League’s wicket-taking charts.

The San Francisco Unicorns has recruited Xavier Bartlett to its pace bowling department for the upcoming Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) season.

Following a breakthrough couple of seasons—domestically, where he finished the 2023–24 Big Bash League as the leading wicket-taker for Brisbane Heat, and internationally, having earned his debut caps for Australia in both white-ball formats—Bartlett is now set to form a potent fast-bowling attack alongside Pakistan international Haris Rauf.

With seven T20I performances under his belt, taking 11 wickets at an economy of just 6.84 and a best of 3/13, ‘Big X’ as he’s nicknamed, is a significant boon to the Unicorns set-up, with his ferocious bowling and handy lower order batting set to thrill the home crowds as the Unicorns play in the Bay Area for the first time.

Xavier Bartlett is the latest addition to the Unicorns’ roster for the 2025 MLC season, with fellow Australian all-rounder Cooper Connolly already announced, along with New Zealand wicketkeeper Tim Seifert.

Xavier Bartlett said: “To play alongside and against some of the best international cricketers around in this year’s MLC, under the tutelage of Shane Watson, is an opportunity too good to turn down.

“The Unicorns is an exciting franchise with a real opportunity of winning the championship this year. I can’t wait to get started, hopefully grabbing some early wickets in what we plan to make an intimidating home fortress at the Oakland Coliseum.”

Shane Watson, Head Coach of San Francisco Unicorns, said: “Xavier has shown his prowess leading the bowling attack for the Brisbane Heat in the Big Bash League and he will be a great addition to the Unicorns bowling line up with his wicket-taking ability with the new ball for this coming 2025 MLC tournament.”

“Having developed through the national pathways in Australia and onto the international scene, he’s matured into a very clever pace bowler, able to both keep the rate down and break key partnerships, and alongside Haris [Rauf], and our skilled domestic fast bowling contingent, we’re now well set in that department.”

The San Francisco Unicorns will kick off the 2025 MLC season at the Oakland Coliseum in California, opening the tournament against last year’s champions, Washington Freedom, on Thursday, June 12. They’ll play two more matches at the same venue—facing the LA Knight Riders on June 14 and MI New York on June 15—before the teams move on to the next set of fixtures at Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.

title: Major League Cricket Moves Headquarters to Grand Prairie, Texas: 2025 Season Set for Record Growth
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC), the ambitious T20 cricket league that’s rapidly changing the American sports landscape, has officially relocated its headquarters from San Francisco to Grand Prairie, Texas. This strategic move cements Grand Prairie Stadium as the epicenter of professional cricket in the United States and signals the league’s next phase of expansion and fan engagement.

Why Grand Prairie?

Since its opening in 2023, Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium—a converted minor league baseball venue—has become a hub for cricket fans from diverse backgrounds. The stadium has already hosted MLC matches and even World Cup games, drawing thousands of fans and attracting significant advertiser interest. The venue’s central location and world-class facilities make it the perfect headquarters as MLC eyes continued growth in the U.S.

Must Read: Major League Cricket USA 2025 – Match Schedules, Locations and Timings

What’s New for the 2025 Season?

Headquarters Move: The league’s administrative and operational base is now officially in Grand Prairie, marking a new era for U.S. cricket.

Expanded Schedule: The 2025 season will feature 34 matches across three states—California, Texas, and Florida—making it the largest professional cricket tournament ever held in the U.S..

Grand Prairie at the Center: Grand Prairie Stadium will host 12 regular-season matches from June 20–29, including the Texas Super Kings’ home opener against the San Francisco Unicorns. The stadium will also stage the playoffs and the championship final from July 8–13, ensuring the biggest games are played in front of some of the league’s most passionate fans.

Night Matches: To beat the Texas summer heat, most games in Grand Prairie will be played at night, making for a more comfortable and electric atmosphere.

Star Power: Fans can expect to see international cricket stars like Rashid Khan, Glenn Maxwell, and Faf Du Plessis, alongside the best U.S.-based talent.

Economic and Cultural Impact

MLC’s presence in Texas is already being felt. Last year’s Men’s T20 World Cup matches in Texas generated over $100 million in economic activity through tourism, hospitality, and local business growth. Grand Prairie Mayor Ron Jensen, once a baseball loyalist, has become a vocal cricket supporter, emphasizing the sport’s role in putting the city on the global map and uniting communities.

Check Out Now: How Many Teams and Matches Are There in Major League Cricket 2025?

A New Era for U.S. Cricket

MLC’s new CEO, Johnny Grave—an international cricket veteran—brings a wealth of experience as the league enters its pivotal third season. With cricket set to return to the Olympics in 2028, the league’s growth trajectory appears unstoppable, and Grand Prairie is at the heart of it all. Also Read: MLC 2025 Season Preview: Teams, Captains & Key Players to Watch

What’s Next?

The 2025 season kicks off June 12 in Oakland, California, before heading to Texas and Florida. Tickets for Grand Prairie matches start at $20, with early bird venue passes available for die-hard fans. The Texas Super Kings’ first home game is set for June 20, promising a vibrant, festival-like atmosphere.

Major League Cricket’s move to Grand Prairie is more than just a change of address—it’s a statement of intent. With a packed schedule, international stars, and a booming fanbase, the 2025 season is poised to be the league’s most exciting yet, solidifying Grand Prairie as the home of cricket in America
